intro: Hieracium thapsifolium subsp. linguiforme, commonly known as the broadleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lanceolate to ovate leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early autumn, producing yellow flowers that are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. The subspecies is distinguished by its broader leaf shape compared to other Hieracium species, contributing to its unique botanical identification.
